page.title: 03SCHOOL CHILDREN
page.content: The Southill Lower School uniform consisted of a grey or white shirt/blouse,grey trousers/skirt,a grey jumper or cardigan and a two toned blue striped tie.The school uniform was not compulsary. Occasionally the children at the school would go on outings with their teachers.An example of one of these outings was a trip to the{'Stoke {Brewen Canal Museum.'}When asked if they would like to see any changes in the school the children replied "We would like to see it repainted,it's getting old." The eight to nine year olds also enjoyed school,although they were not as enthusiastic as the six to seven year olds.
